Package infodynamics.measures.continuous

Interface ChannelCalculatorCommon

  • All Superinterfaces:
    EmpiricalNullDistributionComputer, InfoMeasureCalculatorContinuous
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ChannelCalculator, ChannelCalculatorMultiVariate, ConditionalTransferEntropyCalculator, MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariate, TransferEntropyCalculator, TransferEntropyCalculatorMultiVariate
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ConditionalTransferEntropyCalculatorGaussian, ConditionalTransferEntropyCalculatorKraskov, ConditionalTransferEntropyCalculatorViaCondMutualInfo, MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateGaussian, MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateKernel, MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateKraskov, MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateKraskov1, MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateKraskov2, MutualInfoMultiVariateCommon, TransferEntropyCalculatorGaussian, TransferEntropyCalculatorKernel, TransferEntropyCalculatorKernelPlain, TransferEntropyCalculatorKernelPlainIterators, TransferEntropyCalculatorKernelSeparate, TransferEntropyCalculatorKraskov, TransferEntropyCalculatorMultiVariateGaussian, TransferEntropyCalculatorMultiVariateKernel, TransferEntropyCalculatorMultiVariateKraskov, TransferEntropyCalculatorMultiVariateSingleObservationsKernel, TransferEntropyCalculatorMultiVariateViaCondMutualInfo, TransferEntropyCalculatorSymbolic, TransferEntropyCalculatorViaCondMutualInfo, TransferEntropyCommon
    public interface ChannelCalculatorCommon
extends InfoMeasureCalculatorContinuous, EmpiricalNullDistributionComputer
    A basic interface for calculators computing measures on a channel from a source to a destination time-series (i.e. mutual information and transfer entropy). In the following, we refer to the abstract measure computed by this calculator as the "channel measure".

    The interface is abstract because further specification is required for addObservations or setObservations methods showing whether this is a univariate (ChannelCalculator) or multivariate ChannelCalculatorMultiVariate measure.

    Usage of the child classes implementing this interface is intended to follow this paradigm:

    1. Construct the calculator;
    2. Set properties using InfoMeasureCalculatorContinuous.setProperty(String, String);
    3. Initialise the calculator using InfoMeasureCalculatorContinuous.initialise() or other initialise methods defined by child classes;
    4. Provide the observations/samples for the calculator to set up the PDFs, using:
      • a "setObservations" method (defined by child classes) for calculations based on single time-series, OR
      • The following sequence:
        1. startAddObservations(), then
        2. One or more calls to "addObservations" methods (defined by children), then
        3. finaliseAddObservations();
    5. Compute the required quantities, being one or more of:
      • the average of the channel measure: InfoMeasureCalculatorContinuous.computeAverageLocalOfObservations();
      • the local channel measure values for these samples: computeLocalOfPreviousObservations()
      • local channel measure values for a specific set of samples: "computeLocalUsingPreviousObservations" (to be defined by child classes);
      • the distribution of the channel measure values under the null hypothesis of no relationship between source and destination values: EmpiricalNullDistributionComputer.computeSignificance(int) or EmpiricalNullDistributionComputer.computeSignificance(int[][]).
    6. Return to step 2 or 3 to re-use the calculator on a new data set.
    Author:
    Joseph Lizier (email, www)
    See Also:
    ChannelCalculator, ChannelCalculatorMultiVariate

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      double[] computeLocalOfPreviousObservations()
      Computes the local values of the implemented channel measure, for each valid observation in the previously supplied observations (with PDFs computed using all of the previously supplied observation sets).
      void finaliseAddObservations()
      Signal that the observations are now all added, PDFs can now be constructed.
      boolean getAddedMoreThanOneObservationSet()
      Query whether the user has added more than a single observation set via the startAddObservations(), "addObservations" (defined by child interfaces and classes), finaliseAddObservations() sequence.
      void startAddObservations()
      Signal that we will add in the samples for computing the PDF from several disjoint time-series or trials via calls to "addObservations" rather than "setObservations" type methods (defined by the child interfaces and classes).

    • Method Detail

      • startAddObservations

        void startAddObservations()
        Signal that we will add in the samples for computing the PDF from several disjoint time-series or trials via calls to "addObservations" rather than "setObservations" type methods (defined by the child interfaces and classes).

      • finaliseAddObservations

        void finaliseAddObservations()
                      throws java.lang.Exception
        Signal that the observations are now all added, PDFs can now be constructed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getAddedMoreThanOneObservationSet

        boolean getAddedMoreThanOneObservationSet()
        Query whether the user has added more than a single observation set via the startAddObservations(), "addObservations" (defined by child interfaces and classes), finaliseAddObservations() sequence.
        Returns:
        true if more than a single observation set was supplied

      • computeLocalOfPreviousObservations

        double[] computeLocalOfPreviousObservations()
                                     throws java.lang.Exception

        Computes the local values of the implemented channel measure, for each valid observation in the previously supplied observations (with PDFs computed using all of the previously supplied observation sets).

        If the samples were supplied via a single call such as #setObservations(double[]), then the return value is a single time-series of local channel measure values corresponding to these samples.

        Otherwise where disjoint time-series observations were supplied using several calls such as addObservations(double[]) then the local values for each disjoint observation set will be appended here to create a single "time-series" return array.

        Returns:
        the "time-series" of local channel measure values.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
